content: spira mitts materials yarn any dk weight may be used or lighter fingering weight/sock weight yarn may be held doubled finished size s small or medium the small to fit smaller women s sizes the medium to fit larger women and smaller men s sizes these mitts are intended to fit snugly with negative ease if you prefer a looser fit i would recommend going up a needle size using heavier yarn i e worsted weight or making a larger size the directions are written for the small with instructions for the medium size in parentheses for example knit 2 3 gauge 6 stitches to the inch in stockinette needles us 4 3 5mm or size to obtain correct gauge either double pointed needles or circular s knitter s choice glossary k = knit p = purl pm = place marker m1l = make 1 left m1r = make 1 right m1p = make 1 purlwise sm = slip marker k2tog = knit 2 together ssk = slip 1 slip 1 knit 2 together through the back loop notes the instructions are for a left and right mitt constructed the same except for swapping out the left cable chart for the right cable chart the mitts are interchangeable and may be worn on either hand pattern copyright to holly terrell 2015 you are welcome to use this pattern to knit your own mitts mitts as a gift or for charitable purposes you may not sell the pattern itself or the finished goods made from this pattern or give this pattern away to sell yarn please direct any questions to corvidae on ravelry thank you for knitting my design 1 spira mitts cuff cast on 48 60 stitches and join to work in the round making sure not to twist you may wish to place a marker to indicate the beginning/end of the round i use the long tail method to cast on but any stretchy cast on you wish to use will work fine work in knit 4 purl 2 rib for 1 inch then start left cable chart you will repeat the chart five times vertically 30 rounds before beginning the gusset increases gusset m1r = bring the tip of the left-hand needle under the strand between stitches from back to front knit this loop m1l = bring the tip of the left-hand needle under the strand between stitches from front to back knit through the back of the loop m1p = bring the tip of the left-hand needle under the strand between stitches from back to front purl this loop round 1 work in established pattern for 22 stitches pm m1p k2 m1p pm work in established pattern to end of round round 2-3 knit in pattern to marker sm p1 knit to one stitch before next marker p1 sm knit remaining stitches in pattern round 4 knit in pattern to marker sm p1 m1r k2 m1l p1 sm knit remaining stitches in pattern 6 stitches between markers
